pullRequest.body:
This make the notation much nicer, but I'm pretty sure this is a bad idea for performance / ambiguity reasons.

---

nodes.body:
Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8a48eb6c-44e9-4cfc-a3fa-c972cd37ded8) for commit f2ce5ee2ca8dfa7d049de01b9d60f506ca47de77.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/6aadd81d-7de3-48b4-94d8-8dc8cf6a51f4) for commit 0171bcf75adffcef8f3f42621725d41119d15693.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/34369542-858d-4be7-87c5-a861d484ac53/to/6aadd81d-7de3-48b4-94d8-8dc8cf6a51f4) against commit 038fe40c101de4ef704c77f8f75ee38f12f89ea7:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.DirectSum.Ring                    instructions     7.8%
- ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.EvenEquiv   instructions    21.8%
- ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorPower                 instructions    25.0%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.GradedAlgebra.Basic            instructions    12.9%
```

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/404f6d57-3368-4b29-ab9e-b69bd6488c71) for commit 6efa1d854f0f047193cf7f9d3e974d95278aa71d.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

pullRequest.title: refactor(Algebra/GradedMonoid): Use `HMul` to define `GMul`
